work.name: FISPAN
work.summary: Leading two teams responsible for all client-facing systems (ERPs as well as internal/external tools). Developing and implementing development and QA best practices as well as doing continued architecture reviews.

work.name: FISPAN
work.summary: Leading a team of five developers, one QA and one Coop in a SCRUM setup to deliver quality enhancements to our existing ERP's as well as integrating brand new ERP's into the FISPAN platform.

work.name: FISPAN
work.summary: Creating the very first iteration of the Netsuite and Intacct extension. In addition to that building and designing the internal sync engine that powers a lot of FISPAN's magic.

work.name: Cogindo Solutions Inc.
work.summary: Building custom software to full fill the customers needs. Some projects include:  Prototype of a mobile game to teach science and a sailing school management software.

work.name: Surespan Digital
work.summary: Developed on the Go99 App. An application that allows independent truck drivers to bid on posted jobs instead of having to go through am external (and often expensive) third party broker. Worked primarily on the backend and help get the idea of the ground.

work.name: Hyperwallet
work.summary: Leading a team of four developers and one QA. As a SCRUM team we migrated successful the client portal from an old JSP UI to a brand new re-designed JSF based design as well as developed a developer portal to allow interested developers to easily explore and test the Hyperwallet API's.

work.name: Hyperwallet
work.summary: Responsible for the mobile apps (native android and iOS) which included building a system to easily brand and deploy them. As well as creating the payout web user interface that allows end customers to select how they get paid. The last big challenge in this role was creating a embeddable widget to enter bank account information which supports bank accounts world wide including their unique validation rules.

work.name: Florian Krauthan
work.summary: Build various custom applications for customers around Munich. A couple of examples: A callcenter billing tool, a local yellow pages application and a movie crowdfunding portal.

work.name: 1&1 Internet AG
work.summary: PhotoManager Development (a web photo album) for GMX, WEB.DE and 1&1

work.name: 1&1 Internet AG
work.summary: Apprentice as an IT Specialist for Application Development. As part of the apprenticeship I've worked in software development, DevOps as well as product management.

volunteer.summary: The Marine Mammal Rescue Centre is Canada's only dedicated marine mammal rescue facility and one of the largest in the world.
Every year Jericho Rescue volunteers help over 200 mariners in peril. Beyond on-water support the team also provides a free safety seminar to anyone interested in attending.
Coding for kids (KCJ) is a non profit organisation dedicated to helping kids learn how to code by supporting teachers, educators, parents, volunteers and communities.
GIRLsmarts4tech is the chance for girls in grade 7 to explore and learn about computer science. We have hands-on activities and cool demos.

The orchestra's mission is to give people easy access to learn an instrument and participate in an locally well known orchestra. In addition to that they organize activities like going to an movie studio, learn to cook and many more to keep the youth engaged.

references.name: Tashfeen Mahmud
references.reference:
At times you have to write the phrase "I was fortunate to have worked with [person] at [company]..." without really meaning it. But in the case of Florian, I certainly mean it; it was a privilege to work with him. It's astonishing to witness the breadth of his technical knowledge, especially given that he's still quite young. The fact that Hyperwallet now boasts one of the best API developer experiences in the FinTech industry owes a great deal to him. 

Flo is a ridiculously fast learner, and efficient almost to a fault. One might be led to think that such qualities would render him unfit to be a leader, when in fact they had the opposite effect -- he was great at planning and distributing tasks. Above all, Flo is meticulous and fair. He also happens to be a really cool guy. 

One of the most talented developers I have ever worked with for sure, and hopefully one day I'll get a chance to work with him again.

references.name: JÃ¶rg Wendland
references.reference: Florian is a talented software developer with loads of ideas and always eager to learn something new.
